sen.j: 院号（いんごう）とは以下のことを指す。
sen.e: Ingo means followings.
sen.cmt: 原文変更しました(以下のことを指す）を追加）。
sen.e: Ingo means followings.
Ingo means followings.

sen.j: 太上天皇の称号。
sen.e: A title of Daijo Tenno (the Retired Emperor)
sen.cmt: 原文変更しました（「を指す」を削除）。
sen.e: A title of Daijo Tenno (the Retired Emperor)
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: A title of Daijo Tenno (the Retired Emperor)

sen.j: 天皇の追号。
sen.e: A posthumous title of the Emperor
A posthumous title of the Emperor
A posthumous title of the Emperor

sen.j: 女院の称号。
sen.e: A title of Nyoin (woman bestowed with the title "in")
A title of Nyoin (woman bestowed with the title "in")
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: A title of Nyoin (woman bestowed with the title "in")

sen.j: 皇族の優遇のために贈られた院号。
sen.e: A title conferred on the Imperial family for good treatment
A title conferred on the Imperial Family for good treatment
sen.cmt: Imperial family → Imperial Family に変更しました。
sen.e: A title conferred on the Imperial Family for good treatment

sen.j: 寺院の称号。
sen.e: A title of a temple
A title of a temple
A title of a temple

sen.j: 摂家・足利将軍家・徳川将軍家・大名家以下武士、民衆の戒名として用いた称号。
sen.e: A title which used as Kaimyo (a post humous Buddist name) of Sekke (line of regents and advisers), Ashikaga Shogun family, Tokugawa Shogun family, Daimyo family (feudal lord family) and other samurai, and the people

A title which was used as a Kaimyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) for the Sekke (line of regents and advisers), Ashikaga Shogun family, Tokugawa Shogun family, Daimyo family (feudal lord family) and other samurai, and the people
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。 which used → which was used、post humous → posthumous、Buddist → Buddhist に訂正しました。
sen.e: A title which was used as a Kaimyo (a posthumous Buddhist name) for the Sekke (line of regents and advisers), Ashikaga Shogun family, Tokugawa Shogun family, Daimyo family (feudal lord family) and other samurai, and the people

sen.j: 関連するものとして、院殿号、寺殿号、軒号などがある。
sen.e: Indengo, Jidengo, and Kengo are related to Ingo.
Indengo, Jidengo, and Kengo are related to Ingo.
Indengo, Jidengo, and Kengo are related to Ingo.

sen.j: 院号
sen.e: Ingo
Ingo
Ingo

sen.j: 上皇の尊称としての院号
sen.e: Ingo as an honorific title of the Retired Emperor
Ingo as an honorific title of the Retired Emperor
Ingo as an honorific title of the Retired Emperor

sen.j: 823年(弘仁14年)、嵯峨天皇が京都の嵯峨に御所を移し、嵯峨院と称せられたことにより、太上天皇の異称としての院号が定着するようになった。
sen.e: In 823, the title Ingo came to be known as the different name of Daijo Tenno when Emperor Saga moved the Imperial Palace to Saga, Kyoto and was called Sagain.
In 823, the title Ingo came to be known as the different name of Daijo Tenno when Emperor Saga moved the Imperial Palace to Saga, Kyoto and was called Sagain.
In 823, the title Ingo came to be known as the different name of Daijo Tenno when Emperor Saga moved the Imperial Palace to Saga, Kyoto and was called Sagain.

sen.j: 例えば、冷泉天皇や円融天皇がそれぞれ譲位後に冷泉院、円融院と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Similarly, Emperor Reizei and Emperor Enyu were called Reizeiin and Enyuin respectively after they left their thrones.
Similarly, Emperor Reizei and Emperor Enyu were called Reizeiin and Enyuin respectively after they left their thrones.
Similarly, Emperor Reizei and Emperor Enyu were called Reizeiin and Enyuin respectively after they left their thrones.

sen.j: 当初は存命中に譲位した天皇を指すものであったが、在位中に崩御した天皇に対しても追号として院号を贈る慣例が出来るようになった。
sen.e: At first, Ingo indicated an Emperor who left his throne while he was alive, but it became a custom to confer Ingo as a posthumous title on the Emperor who passed away during his reign.
At first, Ingo indicated an emperor who left his throne while he was alive, but it became a custom to confer Ingo as a posthumous title on the Emperor who passed away during his reign.
sen.cmt: an Emperor → an emperor に訂正しました。
sen.e: At first, Ingo indicated an emperor who left his throne while he was alive, but it became a custom to confer Ingo as a posthumous title on the Emperor who passed away during his reign.

sen.j: なお、時期によっては上皇・法皇の数が複数になる場合もあった。
sen.e: Sometimes, there was more than one Retired Emperor or Cloistered Emperor.
Sometimes, there was more than one Retired Emperor or Cloistered Emperor.
Sometimes, there was more than one Retired Emperor or Cloistered Emperor.

sen.j: その際には御在所の名称で呼ぶ（場合によっては崩御後にそのまま追号となる場合もある）か、在位の前後において一院（本院とも）・中院（3名以上いる場合）・新院と呼んで区別した。
sen.e: In that situation, they were discriminated from by being called their residence's name (sometimes it became their posthumous title after their death) or Ichiin (or Honin), Chuin (when there were more than three) or Shinin in their reign order.

In that situation, they were discriminated from by being called their residence's name (sometimes it became their posthumous title after their death) or Ichiin (or Honin), Chuin (when there were more than three) or Shinin in their reign order.
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: In that situation, they were discriminated from by being called their residence's name (sometimes it became their posthumous title after their death) or Ichiin (or Honin), Chuin (when there were more than three) or Shinin in their reign order.

sen.j: 女院の尊称としての院号
sen.e: Ingo as an honorific title of Nyoin
Ingo as an honorific title of Nyoin
Ingo as an honorific title of Nyoin

sen.j: 一条天皇の母后である皇太后藤原詮子が東三条院の女院を受けることがきっかけとなり、朝廷では皇后や皇太后、太皇太后などの三后にも、院号を贈ることが慣習化した。
sen.e: The Empress Dowager, "FUJIWARA no Senshi", who was Emperor Ichijo's mother, got a title of Nyoin as Higashi Sanjoin, which started a custom that Ingo was conferred on three Empresses: the Empress, the Empress Dowager, and the Grand Empress Dowager, in the Imperial Court.

The Empress Dowager, "FUJIWARA no Senshi", who was Emperor Ichijo's mother, got a title of Nyoin as Higashi Sanjoin, which started a custom that Ingo was conferred on three Empresses: the Empress, the Empress Dowager, and the Grand Empress Dowager, in the Imperial Court.

The Empress Dowager, "FUJIWARA no Senshi", who was Emperor Ichijo's mother, got a title of Nyoin as Higashi Sanjoin, which started a custom that Ingo was conferred on three Empresses: the Empress, the Empress Dowager, and the Grand Empress Dowager, in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 女院の院号を定める公卿の評定を院号定めという。
sen.e: The court hearing held by Kugyo (the court nobles) for giving Ingo was named Ingo-sadame.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The court hearing held by Kugyo (the court nobles) for giving Ingo was named Ingo-sadame.
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: The court hearing held by Kugyo (the court nobles) for giving Ingo was named Ingo-sadame.

sen.j: 藤原詮子以降の院号では、上東門院（藤原彰子）をはじめとした、門院号を贈ることが通例化された。
sen.e: After FUJIWARA no Senshi, conferring the honorific title Moningo became a general rule, including Jotomonin (FUJIWARA no Shoshi).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After FUJIWARA no Senshi, conferring the honorific title Moningo became a general rule, including Jotomonin (FUJIWARA no Shoshi).
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。
sen.e: After FUJIWARA no Senshi, conferring the honorific title Moningo became a general rule, including Jotomonin (FUJIWARA no Shoshi).

sen.j: 院号を授けることを院号宣下という。
sen.e: Conferring Ingo on an Empress was called Ingo Senge.
Conferring Ingo on an empress was called Ingo Senge.
sen.cmt: an Empress → an empress に訂正しました。
sen.e: Conferring Ingo on an empress was called Ingo Senge.

sen.j: 皇族優遇のための院号
sen.e: Ingo for good treatment of the Imperial family
Ingo for good treatment of the Imperial Family
sen.cmt: Imperial family → Imperial Family に訂正しました。
sen.e: Ingo for good treatment of the Imperial Family

sen.j: 皇位につかなかった皇太子、或いは天皇の実父ながら親王の身位に留まる皇族などに対して、しばしば太上天皇或いは准太上天皇の尊号が贈られた。
sen.e: Honorary titles: Daijo Tenno or Jun Daijo Tenno (quasi ex-Emperor), were conferred on the crown prince who didn't ascend to the throne and the Emperor's father even though he was never the Emperor.
Honorary titles: Daijo Tenno or Jun Daijo Tenno (quasi ex-emperor) were conferred on the crown prince who did not ascend to the throne and the Emperor's father who stayed as the imperial prince.
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。quasi ex-Emperor → quasi ex-emperor、didn't → did not に訂正しました。カッコの後のコンマを削除しました。 Even though 以降に「親王の身位に留まる」の訳が見られなかったので、even though 以降を変更しました。
sen.e: Honorary titles: Daijo Tenno or Jun Daijo Tenno (quasi ex-emperor) were conferred on the crown prince who did not ascend to the throne and the Emperor's father who stayed as the imperial prince.

sen.j: 皇位継承をしなかった皇太子に贈られた例は、敦明親王が小一条院の院号を受けたという例がある。
sen.e: It is an example of the former case that Imperial Prince Atsuakira got Ingo as Koichijoin.
As an example of the former case, Imperial Prince Atsuakira received Ingo as Koichijoin.
sen.cmt: 文の構成を少し変更しました。 got → received に変更しました。
sen.e: As an example of the former case, Imperial Prince Atsuakira received Ingo as Koichijoin.

sen.j: その他、皇位についていない親王の皇子が天皇の後継に立てられ即位した場合にも天皇の実父として院号が贈られた制度がある(太上天皇参照)。
sen.e: There was a rule that the Imperial Prince who didn't ascend to the throne was given Ingo as the father of the Emperor when his son was enthroned (See Daijo Tenno).
There was a rule that the Imperial Prince who did not ascend to the throne was given Ingo as the father of the Emperor when his son was enthroned. (See Daijo Tenno)
sen.cmt: didn't → did not に変更しました。
sen.e: There was a rule that the Imperial Prince who did not ascend to the throne was given Ingo as the father of the Emperor when his son was enthroned. (See Daijo Tenno)

sen.j: 寺院の称号
sen.e: Ingo as a title of a temple
Ingo as a title of a temple
Ingo as a title of a temple

sen.j: 平安時代以降、皇族が門跡となっている寺院などに対して院号が許された。
sen.e: After the Heian period, temples where members of Imperial family entered priesthood were allowed to have the Ingo.
After the Heian period, temples where members of Imperial Family entered priesthood were allowed to have the Ingo.
sen.cmt: Imperial family → Imperial Family に変更しました。
sen.e: After the Heian period, temples where members of Imperial Family entered priesthood were allowed to have the Ingo.

sen.j: 戒名としての院号
sen.e: Ingo as Kaimyo
Ingo as Kaimyo
Ingo as Kaimyo

sen.j: もとは天皇、三后のみに許されていた院号が、臣下にも普及するようになったのは、関白藤原兼家が法興院を称したことによる。
sen.e: Ingo, which was originally conferred on only the Emperor and three Empresses: the Empress, the Empress Dowager and the Grand Empress Dowager, began being conferred among subjects with the chief adviser to the Emperor, FUJIWARA no Kaneie called Hokoin.

Ingo, which was originally conferred on only the Emperor and three Empresses: the Empress, the Empress Dowager and the Grand Empress Dowager, began being conferred among subjects when the chief adviser to the Emperor, FUJIWARA no Kaneie called himself as Hokoin.
sen.cmt: with → when、called → called himself as に変更しました。
sen.e: Ingo, which was originally conferred on only the Emperor and three Empresses: the Empress, the Empress Dowager and the Grand Empress Dowager, began being conferred among subjects when the chief adviser to the Emperor, FUJIWARA no Kaneie called himself as Hokoin.

sen.j: 平安時代から鎌倉時代までは、当初は天皇や皇族、ひいては摂家や将軍家の戒名として院号が用いられた。
sen.e: From the Heian period to the Kamakura period, Ingo was used as Kaimyo of the Emperor and the Imperial family at first, and then Sekke and Shogun families as well.
From the Heian period to the Kamakura period, Ingo was used as Kaimyo of the Emperor and the Imperial Family at first, and then Sekke and Shogun families as well.
sen.cmt: Imperial family → Imperial Family に変更しました。
sen.e: From the Heian period to the Kamakura period, Ingo was used as Kaimyo of the Emperor and the Imperial Family at first, and then Sekke and Shogun families as well.

sen.j: しかし、時代が下るにつれ、院号は大名やその正室及び側室の俗名戒名、家臣の戒名にまで広がりを見せる。
sen.e: However, as times passed, Ingo spread as a more common name and Kaimyo of Japanese feudal lord, his lawful wife, and his concubine or as Kaimyo of vassals.
However, as times passed, Ingo spread as a more common Kaimyo for a Japanese feudal lord, his lawful wife and concubine or vassals.
sen.cmt: common name → common Kaimyo に変更し、続く部分もそれに従って変更しました。
sen.e: However, as time passed, the use of Ingo as a Kaimyo for Japanese feudal lords, their lawful wives and concubines, and even their vassals became increasingly common.

sen.j: そればかりか、室町時代以降は院号の上位の号として院殿号や寺殿号が成立するなど、戒名としての院号は第二位の称号となった。
sen.e: Moreover, after the Muromachi period, Indengo and Jidengo came into being as higher rank titles, so Ingo as Kaimyo became the second rank.
Moreover, after the Muromachi period, Indengo and Jidengo came into being as higher rank titles, and Ingo as Kaimyo became the second rank.
sen.cmt: so → and に変更しました。
sen.e: Moreover, after the Muromachi period, Indengo and Jidengo came into being as higher rank titles, and Ingo as Kaimyo became the second rank.

sen.j: 現在では、在家信者にも、戒名・法名 (浄土真宗)に付されるようになる。
sen.e: Today, Ingo comes to be appended to Kaimyo and Homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name in Jodo Shinshu [the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism]) of lay believers.
Today, Ingo is appended to Kaimyo and Homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name in Jodo Shinshu [the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism]) of lay believers.
sen.cmt: comes to be appended → is appended に変更しました。
sen.e: Today, Ingo is appended to Kaimyo and Homyo (a posthumous Buddhist name in Jodo Shinshu [the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism]) of lay believers.

sen.j: 戒名に、院号と位号（居士、大姉、信士、信女など）を付すことが、標準的と認識されるようになる。
sen.e: It came to be recognized as standard that Kaimyo is consists of Ingo and Igo (for example, Koji, Daishi, Shinshi and Shinnyo).
It came to be recognized as standard that Kaimyo consists of Ingo and Igo (for example, Koji, Daishi, Shinshi and Shinnyo).
sen.cmt: カッコ内両端の空白を削除しました。 is consists of → consists of に訂正しました。
sen.e: It came to be recognized as standard that Kaimyo consists of Ingo and Igo (for example, Koji, Daishi, Shinshi and Shinnyo).

sen.j: 特に院号と位号を合わせて院居士・院信士と俗称される。
sen.e: Especially, combined Ingo and Igo is commonly called Inkoji and Inshinshi.
Especially, the name combined Ingo and Igo is commonly called Inkoji and Inshinshi.
sen.cmt: combined の前にthe name を追加しました。
sen.e: Especially, the name combined Ingo and Igo is commonly called Inkoji and Inshinshi.

sen.j: 浄土真宗など宗旨によっては、位号を用いない。
sen.e: Some sects, such as Jodo Shinshu don't use Igo.
Some sects, such as Jodo Shinshu do not use Igo.
sen.cmt: don't → do not に変更しました。
sen.e: Some sects, such as Jodo Shinshu do not use Igo.
